summary: This is a transcript of a sworn interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with the former Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The interview covers events from July to August 2019, including the July 23 incident, cellmate selection, staff failures in counts and rounds, the transfer of cellmate Efrain Reyes, the unmonitored phone call, camera system issues, and the warden's perspective on institutional failures leading to Epstein's suicide.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: High-profile inmate who died by suicide in the MCC Special Housing Unit (SHU) on August 10, 2019. The interview extensively discusses the circumstances surrounding his death, including prior incidents, housing, and staff supervision.

persons.name: Edward Hayes
persons.context: Attorney representing the interviewee (the former warden) during the OIG interview. He is present, makes occasional comments, and clarifies legal points.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate prior to July 23, 2019. The incident on July 23 involved an inconclusive investigation into whether Tartaglione assaulted Epstein or Epstein attempted suicide.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate after Tartaglione. He was transferred out of MCC (With All Belongings - WAB) on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein without a cellmate, which was a required safety measure.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Correctional Officer who was on suicide watch for Epstein on July 23 and who found Epstein unresponsive on August 10. His actions and job performance are discussed.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Correctional Officer who was partnered with Michael Thomas on the morning watch shift when Epstein was found. She was a newer employee.

persons.name: Mariel Colon
persons.context: One of Epstein's attorneys who made housing requests to MCC staff, as mentioned in an email.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: One of Epstein's attorneys who inquired about housing Epstein alone in the SHU, as mentioned in an email.

persons.name: El Chapo
persons.context: High-profile inmate previously housed in the MCC's Ten South unit (Special Administrative Measures unit). Mentioned as an example of appropriate housing for certain high-profile inmates.

connections.description: Were cellmates in the SHU. An incident on July 23, 2019, led to an inconclusive investigation about an assault or suicide attempt.
Were cellmates after Tartaglione. Reyes was transferred out on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein without a required cellmate.
Correctional Officers partnered on the morning watch shift in the SHU when Epstein was found. Both were responsible for counts and rounds.
Hayes is the attorney representing the former warden during the OIG interview.

events.title: First Incident with Epstein
events.description: Epstein found in fetal position in his cell with a red neck. Inconclusive whether it was a suicide attempt or an altercation with cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. Placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Psychological Observation
events.description: Epstein was cleared by psychology and taken off psychological observation/suicide watch. He was returned to the SHU with a requirement to have a cellmate.

events.title: Cellmate Reyes Transferred
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes was transferred out of MCC (With All Belongings - WAB), leaving Epstein without a cellmate. Staff failed to replace him or properly notify supervisors.

events.title: Unmonitored Phone Call
events.description: Epstein was given an unmonitored social call on a legal line by a unit manager. He requested to call his mother (who was deceased), a man answered, and the call was not properly monitored.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., Correctional Officers Michael Thomas and Tova Noel found Epstein unresponsive in his cell with a torn bedsheet around his neck. CPR was initiated, and he was later pronounced dead at the hospital.

events.title: Warden Removed from MCC
events.description: The warden was told to report to the regional office and was removed from his position at MCC, though his title remained officially until 2020.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) / Nine South at MCC
keyFacts: Epstein was required to have a cellmate after coming off psychological observation on July 30, but after his cellmate Reyes was transferred on August 9, he was left alone for approximately 24 hours due to a systemic failure in notification and oversight.
SHU staff failed to conduct mandatory 30-minute rounds and accurate inmate counts on August 9-10, 2019. Evidence suggests rounds were not done and count slips were prefilled or inaccurate.
The MCC's camera system in the SHU was antiquated and not recording during the critical period. A new system had been purchased but was not installed due to manpower and funding issues.
The warden believed staff at all levels (SHU officers, lieutenants, captain) shared responsibility for the failure to ensure Epstein had a cellmate and for not conducting proper rounds and counts.
An unmonitored phone call was provided to Epstein on August 9 on a legal line; he said he was calling his deceased mother, a man answered, and the call was not properly monitored by staff.
